seniority_level.evidence: Title is 'Data Engineer' without senior/staff designation, responsibilities include end-to-end development and stakeholder collaboration which suggest mid-level, no explicit years mentioned but scope implies 3-5 years experience

job_family.evidence: Job title is explicitly 'Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on building/maintaining data infrastructure, ELT pipelines, and data warehousing

sub_specialty.evidence: Explicit mention of 'Automating extract, load and transform (ELT) pipelines', 'Data Warehouse/Kimball methodology', and tools like DBT, Fivetran, HVR which are primarily batch-oriented

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of managing people, mentoring, or technical leadership responsibilities; focus is on individual contribution to data platform development and stakeholder collaboration

primary_cloud.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'AWS cloud infrastructure including AWS CDK' and lists Redshift (AWS service) as a core platform

secondary_clouds.evidence: Mentions BigQuery (GCP) and Snowflake (multi-cloud but often paired with Azure) as core platforms, suggesting multi-cloud environment with AWS as primary

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ELT pipelines, data warehousing, and CI/CD practices for batch processing; no mention of real-time streaming technologies like Kafka or Flink

orchestrator_category.evidence: DBT is explicitly listed as a core technology and is primarily used for transformation orchestration in modern data stacks

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions both data warehousing (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift) and data lake patterns (AWS infrastructure, S3 implied), indicating a mixed storage architecture

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restricted to Manchester, England, UK with 'UK only' geo restriction in Pass 1 extraction

timezone_focus.evidence: Explicitly states location as Manchester, England, UK with no mention of global or multi-timezone teams

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requires minimum 50% in-office time in Manchester, and new hires have initial full-time office period, implying relocation may be required for non-local candidates

h1b_friendly.evidence: No mention of visa sponsorship, and location is UK-only, suggesting no H1B sponsorship available

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: UK-based role with no mention of student visa support; 'work authorization' not specified but implied to be UK work rights

citizenship_required.evidence: No explicit citizenship requirement but location restriction to UK implies need for UK work authorization

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent position with comprehensive benefits package including pension, healthcare, and share awards, typical of W2 employment

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits list including equity (share awards), generous PTO (25-31 days), learning support, professional development, health benefits, and unique perks like gym membership and social events

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'Talent development programmes' and 'Ongoing technical training' but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladder described

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions joining 'a dynamic and experienced Data Engineering team' and 'collaborate closely with key stakeholders', suggesting opportunities to learn from senior colleagues

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression paths in the job description

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or opportunities to explore different roles within the company

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks mentioned (IC, management, architect, specialist), though 'Talent development programmes' suggest some structured growth exists

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear must-have skills listed (17 hard skills, 8 soft skills) with no nice-to-haves, suggesting moderate strictness; however, language is not overly rigid and emphasizes adaptability and continuous learning

scope_definition.evidence: Well-defined responsibilities focused on data engineering (ELT pipelines, data warehousing, data modeling, platform maintenance) without mixing with data science or analytics roles

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skill requirements are comprehensive but reasonable for a mid-level data engineer in a financial services context; no unrealistic combinations or excessive years required
